
Intercepted agent messages were encrypted using RSA where both p and q are Blum primes. Can you recover the plaintext from the ciphertext below?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8365310878159625419126876398591038657771957154327698542026840041976290795667162409497585880675836981212376704397488709027715201863798583908010646829301597, e=8034043964469804907318289974681507663048817932007188023528377353602449873124267100550440367531438833250542595850297286768494754212124636286562061315679467
The lower 104 bits of p are: 31694121361784422807794992137694049035


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{lpi5yfpw}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1879552359520384976924008263646936941856257309883760713709621547166179428334142934208907892330995720185804300072778742464325081241572644859191645876352859
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8365310878159625419126876398591038657771957154327698542026840041976290795667162409497585880675836981212376704397488709027715201863798583908010646829301597, e=8034043964469804907318289974681507663048817932007188023528377353602449873124267100550440367531438833250542595850297286768494754212124636286562061315679467
The lower 104 bits of p are: 31694121361784422807794992137694049035

extra_info: p=86542918591567644330735244256572763350220511818940845194224243737183292715787, q=96660836198962025406490806250568697320812676018158285144115599443909757720631, Ï†(n)=8365310878159625419126876398591038657771957154327698542026840041976290795666979205742795351006099755161869562936817675839878102733460244064829553778865180
